name: Hollow Hold
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight up towards the ceiling.

2. Engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help you maintain a stable position.

3. Lift your arms, shoulder blades, and legs off the ground, keeping them in a straight line from head to heels.

4. Keep your pelvis tucked under your body, preventing it from tilting upwards or downwards.

5. Maintain this hollowed-out position for the desired time duration, engaging your core muscles to support your body weight.

6. Release the contraction when you've completed the exercise.
short_summary: The hollow hold is an isometric exercise that primarily targets the abs and lower back muscles, requiring engagement of the core to support the body in a straight line.
